messages.message: Assuming it can be done (not often the case, as changes between images are very interlinked in many circumstances), JPMC should be aware that when they upgrade a single image, they’ll be outside of reasonable expectations for support until they are able to bring everything else back up to the same versions (i.e. if they experience any odd issues afterwards we cannot rule out that the issue is image mismatch related, and can’t assist until they resolve their image mismatch).

i definitely agree with that. I want to make sure JP understands the risk. Additionally, i'd HATE for them to implement the full package and find another issue that requires yet another installation. So if we're going to recommend the more tedious option, we need to feel very sure.
Is JPMC still deployed off that custom branch we made for them? I think it's not sustainable to keep backporting fixes to that custom branch
i will get this answer, The version they're on is 24.04.37. The version you're referring to is 24.04.371
Wait, this needs to be backported to 24.04 as well? I only backported it to 24.07?
@Udit - https://instabase.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/8505
the tag on the related ticket is 24.04 - that may have been missed. Im sorry for the miscommunication on this.
ah well, I'll make the backport right now, but now it may have to be re-certified if this is a huge priority and 24.04 has already been certified today.

@lydia - can you assist? This is indeed a large issue

CC @amber

@tamir which version is JPMC going to take? Will they take the latest 24.04? Let's get an answer on that question before re-certifying.

In the meantime, @Udit send me the backport to 24.04
would it make sense to ask them in the ticket?
is the latest .39?
they'll want to know the differences no matter what
You can find the latest in the docs (https://platform.instabase.com/docs/releasenotes/24.04-relnotes/index.html), with release notes
@Udit I actually don't see a tag yet for today. so maybe not certified yet?
yah Cody said there are issues so theres a chance its not certified yet. I'm making the backport right now -- it has to be done manually
i inquired

Who should we lean on for this discussion?

Hi Tamir ,
Could you please set up a call to discuss about all the potential risks while consuming single image vs full images , also lets discuss about below topics
• The impact for this minor release on other use cases
• Will discuss about the version in the call and will finalize
• We should have backout plan
• What might be the impact if we will delay the minor upgrade in production as there are multiple freeze windows are coming also to check the impact of this fix on other use cases . (UAT will be with 24.04.xx and Prod will be 24.04.37)
• Testing Plan – Amber once talk about testing after upgrade for existing solution . How much it will be feasible in current platform )
Regards,

Bitasta
cc @amber is this something you can help Tamir with? I assume we have standard guidance on this, since sending certified releases has been our policy for some time.

sure @tamir happy to support here; I think it would be good to have someone from CE as well on the backout planning.

but first - reading this thread - is it even possible to isolate to a single image for this particular fix with considering dependencies, etc.? because then it's a different conversation, and we can align on a plan on how to de-risk

I don’t think we should recommend or even speak to it so much. She’ll ask and we should say we don’t have confidence on the dependencies. 
@Armaan - may be able to assist here :eyes:
@Armaan - would you feel comfortable speaking with the JP team about this from the CE perspective?
I can jump in if it ends up early for Armaan, since EST should make for better meeting scheduling

I would -- I can relay specific answers in regards to how they should test this fix on the ticket, and post those details here ahead of time for review before passing those answers along.

Though I understand that this is likely to take place over a call.
yeah they're asking for a call - can we count on @Chuba or @Armaan to hop in from the CE side depending on when they want the call?
I'll be available -- do we have a time for the call tomorrow set up
nothing scheduled - do you have a preferred time for tomorrow? or even today? im EST but i can accommodate if it's soon
Let’s pick a time that allows us a time to sync quickly beforehand and agree on our points/position

Agree. I’m free before 10am ET. Again at 11 and 12. I think they’ll want to meet earlier. Can we suggest 9:30am ET and do a quick sync at 9am? 

@amber is this too early? If so we can choose times above
I'll be free at 9am ET tomorrow to sync ahead of a 9:30 meeting :+1:
@Udit please confirm if we have backport for 24.04.
Thanks @Udit. I see this: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/65076
@Udit just to confirm, if we are giving them just one image, which service would it be?
nginx
